name: Fight Colorectal Cancer
mission: Learn what colorectal cancer is, how it develops, and the key facts, symptoms, and screening guidelines to know.
theoryOfChange: Fight Colorectal Cancer has a published strategic framework called "Our Path to a Cure." This is described as their "visionary roadmap for the future of colorectal cancer research" and the "engine of Fight CRC's research advocacy and strategic planning." The framework is broken down into four pillars: Biology and Etiology, Prevention and Early Detection, Treatment, and Survivorship and Recurrence. Each pillar includes progress indicators, key messages, opportunities, and challenges. Additionally, Fight Colorectal Cancer launched the Colorectal Cancer Care Initiative (CRCCI) and its accompanying Colorectal Cancer Care Report, which sets data-driven, actionable goals for improving colorectal cancer screening, diagnosis, and treatment.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who prioritize health advocacy and want to support a highly efficient, transparent organization focused on colorectal cancer policy and research.
donor_motivations: Value high financial efficiency and low overhead
Care about advancing medical research and patient rights
Prefer supporting established advocacy over direct medical treatment
Want to support an organization with top-tier transparency ratings
giving_considerations: Impact is measured through policy and research milestones rather than individual patient counts
The organization is a mid-sized player in a well-covered health space
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking to fulfill Zakat obligations or those looking for direct international humanitarian aid.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: The organization has <cite id="16">verified outcomes</cite> and a strong theory of change, though it lacks cost-per-beneficiary metrics.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: Fight CRC uses a <cite id="4">community-driven advocacy model</cite> to influence policy and fund research that improves patient outcomes.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that advocacy efforts translate into tangible policy changes and research advancements.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: With a <cite id="12">10.9% growth rate</cite> and significant policy goals, the organization can absorb additional funding to expand its research grants.

strengths.detail: The organization maintains a <cite id="3">program expense ratio of 85.2%</cite>, which is competitive within the global health sector.
Fight CRC spends only <cite id="8">$0.07 to raise every $1</cite>, ensuring minimal donor funds are lost to administrative overhead.
The charity holds a <cite id="9">Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid</cite> and meets <cite id="10">all 20 BBB Wise Giving Alliance Standards</cite>.

strengths_deep_dive: Fight CRC demonstrates a strong commitment to organizational accountability through its <cite id="11">100% independent board of directors</cite>. This governance structure supports a <cite id="12">3-year revenue CAGR of 10.9%</cite>, indicating steady growth and increasing capacity to fund its <cite id="4">Advocacy and Research Advocacy Training</cite> programs. Their financial stability is further evidenced by <cite id="6">12.0 months of operating reserves</cite>, which far exceeds the industry standard for health-focused nonprofits.
rich_narrative.summary: Fight Colorectal Cancer (Fight CRC) serves as a national advocacy powerhouse dedicated to <cite id="1">empowering and activating a community of patients</cite>, caregivers, and families to push for better medical policies and research. Operating with a <cite id="2">total revenue of $3,060,301</cite>, the organization focuses on patient education, research advocacy, and legislative support. The charity maintains a high level of financial efficiency, directing <cite id="3">83.4% of its total expenses toward program services</cite>. This ensures that the vast majority of donor contributions directly fund initiatives like the <cite id="4">Research Advocacy Training & Support (RATS) Program</cite> and national advocacy campaigns. Beyond direct service, Fight CRC acts as a strategic grantmaker, <cite id="5">distributing $27,600 in grants</cite> to both domestic and international partners to further colorectal cancer research and coalition building. The organization's financial health is bolstered by <cite id="6">12.0 months of working capital</cite>, providing significant stability for long-term advocacy goals. While the charity is <cite id="7">SADAQAH-ELIGIBLE</cite>, it provides a critical service in the global health sector, addressing a disease that requires urgent policy intervention and patient support infrastructure.
